description: A Lacework resource for configuring how an alert is handled

PolicyId.description: Policy ID. The convention for policy ID creation is `accountName-remainder`, for example, lws-special-100. When sending a request, you can simply provide `$account-<remainder>`, and Lacework will substitute the `$account` prefix with your actual account name. **Note:** The `-remainder` must use the regex pattern (`^[a-z]{1,16}(-\d{1,8})?$`), and cannot be `default` or start with `default-`.

QueryId.description: Identifier of the query that executes while running the policy.

Enabled.description: When sending a request, use this attribute to enable or disable a policy. When included in a response, returns `True` for enabled policies, or returns `False` for disabled policies.

Remediation.description: Remediation strategy for the events triggered by the policy.

Severity.description: The severity of an event triggered by the policy.

Limit.description: The maximum number of records that each policy will return. The default value is 1000.

AlertEnabled.description: When sending a request, set to `True` if you want to send alerts to an alert profile when the policy is triggered. Set to `False` if you want to mute alerts when the policy is triggered.

AlertProfile.description: The alert profile to use for sending alerts when the policy is triggered.

EvaluatorId.description: Evaluator ID. For POST and PATCH endpoints, the `evaluatorId` field is still accepted but is ignored. No warning is returned if an `evaluatorId` is provided; this behavior may change in the future. For responses from all of these calls, an `evaluatorId` field is no longer returned.

Owner.description: The user who created the policy.

LastUpdateTime.description: The timestamp for when the policy was last updated.

LastUpdateUser.description: The user who last updated the policy.
